meanings.definition: Infarcts (noun): areas of tissue that have died due to lack of blood supply
meanings.sent1: The doctor pointed to the infarcts on the X-ray, showing where the tissue had died.
meanings.sent2: The pathologist examined the infarcts under the microscope to understand the cause of tissue death.
meanings.sent3: The infarcts in the heart were like little ghost towns, abandoned due to lack of blood supply.
meanings.sent4: The infarcts in the brain were like dark clouds, casting a shadow over the affected areas.
meanings.sent5: The infarcts in the lungs were a stark reminder of the consequences of blocked blood flow.

meanings.definition: Infarcts (verb): to cause tissue death due to lack of blood supply
meanings.sent1: Smoking can infarct the lungs, leading to serious health issues.
meanings.sent2: The surgeon worked quickly to prevent the clot from infarcting more tissue.
meanings.sent3: The lack of water infarcted the plant, causing its leaves to wither and die.
meanings.sent4: The virus infarcted the cells, spreading rapidly through the body.
meanings.sent5: The blocked artery infarcted the heart muscle, causing a heart attack.
